articles.title: James Webb Space Telescope captures strange magnetic forces warping Uranus
articles.description: For the first time, scientists have mapped Uranus’s upper atmosphere in three dimensions, tracking temperatures and charged particles up to 5,000 kilometers above the clouds. articles.title: NASA’s Hubble spots nearly invisible “ghost galaxy” made of 99% dark matter
articles.description: Astronomers have uncovered one of the most mysterious galaxies ever found — a dim, ghostly object called CDG-2 that is almost entirely made of dark matter. articles.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
articles.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.
